results.title: De Duva = The Dove
results.creator_credit: Anthony Lover, George Coe, Sid Davis and Coe-Davis Ltd
results.brief_description: A broad travesty of Ingmar Bergman’s thematic and visual style based on ‘Wild Strawberries’, ‘Seventh Seal’ and ‘The Silence’. The dialogue is in Pidgin English spoken with a Swedish accent and dutifully translated by bland English subtitles. Cinematography and editing by Anthony Lover. Written by Sidney Davis. Cast includes David Zirlin, George Coe, Pamela Burrel, Peter Turgeon, Madeline Kahn, Tom Stone, Stan Rubinstein and Sidney Davis.

results.title: Ponds: an introduction
results.creator_credit: Donald Walton, Anvil Films and Record Group and Seabourne Enterprises
results.brief_description: Explains the yearly cycle of pond life, the dependence on warmth and light for growth and the interchange of oxygen and carbon dioxide. The pond returns to rest period when days shorten and the water becomes cold and minerals are replenished from decaying plants and animals in readiness for the circle to begin again.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Donald Walton, Anvil Films and Record Group and Seabourne Enterprises

results.title: Foods: fads and facts
results.brief_description: Discusses the effects of pesticides, preservatives and additives on foods and illustrates how government authorities maintain adequate safety levels on foods through constant supervision of food marketing. Also considers whether organic foods have any more nutritional value than foods grown with help of scientific knowledge. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Mission to Yenan
results.creator_credit: Joe de Cola, Peter F. Davis and Films Incorporated
results.brief_description: Relates the experiences of four former United States Foreign Service China specialists who foresaw the defeat of Chiang Kai-Shek and recommended, at end of World War II, that the United States adopt a more open-ended policy towards Communist China. Their advice was not headed then and they discuss their views in light of subsequent events in Asia.

results.title: Families: earning and spending
results.creator_credit: George McQuilkin, James Kennedy, Jane Treiman and Churchill Films
results.brief_description: Shows the ways in which the three families introduced in the film “Families: alike and different” earn money and how they spend it on a variety of goods and services. The American parents work at separate jobs, the Mexican family is involved in the processing coffee beans and the Japanese father does research into water pollution.

results.title: Night people's day
results.brief_description: Explores the city at night with emphasis on people who work at night and their occupations. The soundtrack recreates, with human voices and sound effects, the variety of sounds of the city and its activities. Night people tell why they prefer to work at night. Photography by Bob Hillman. Vocal sound effects by Bob Kurtz and Glenn Johnson.

results.title: Wheels wheels wheels
results.brief_description: This non-narrated film begins with a small boy launched on a downhill ride curled inside a rubber tyre. The film then proceeds to show various types of wheels: from fly-wheels to paddle-wheels, watchworks to windmills and machine gears to merry-go-rounds.

results.title: Bluegrass country
results.brief_description: A film of the annual Bluegrass Music Festival at Berryville, Virginia. Conveys the history of this indigenous American folk-music through the high-energy performances of the professional musicans and impromtu jam sessions of their fans. The performers discuss their music. No other credits available.

results.title: Henry Moore: master sculptor
results.brief_description: Sculptor Henry Moore discusses and demonstrates how he develops an idea, showing the various steps in the completion of a sculpture and many examples of his work.
